snippet: As the conglomerate looks for a new leader, it’s having difficulty finding someone, even the heir apparent, who appears able to measure up.
abstract: Abrupt decision by Walt Disney's chief operating officer Thomas O Staggs to step down has raised question of whether anyone would be suitable to succeed Robert A Iger as company's chief executive and chairman; Iger has presided over remarkable run, with regular stream of record quarterly results, and lack of clear successor within company raises possibility that Iger will merely continue on in his role.
lead_paragraph: As the conglomerate looks for a new leader, it’s having difficulty finding someone, even the heir apparent, who appears able to measure up.

headline.main: Robert Iger’s Success at Disney Makes Him a Tough Act to Follow
headline.print_headline: Iger Proves a Tough Act to Follow  at Disney
